turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I need to schedule an appointment with Dr. Emily Carter. It's been a real pain trying to get through on the phone.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I can help you schedule an appointment with Dr. Carter. Do you have a preferred date or time range?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm pretty flexible, but ideally sometime next week. Mornings work best for me.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, let me check Dr. Carter's availability next week. One moment... It looks like she has an opening on Tuesday at 9:00 AM and another on Thursday at 10:30 AM. Would either of those work?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Tuesday at 9:00 AM sounds perfect. What do I need to do to confirm?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I have tentatively scheduled you for Tuesday at 9:00 AM. To confirm, can you please provide your date of birth and insurance provider?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's 03/15/1988. And my insurance is Blue Cross Blue Shield. One question, though - is this a telehealth appointment or in person? I kind of assumed it was in person, but just want to double check.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Checking... This appointment is currently scheduled as an in-person visit. Do you prefer telehealth?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: No, in-person is fine! Thanks so much for your help, this was way easier than calling.
